intro: Elatostematoides wenzelii, commonly known as the Wenzel's elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in heathland and shrubland ecosystems. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
